abstract: Cisco Systems held a contest to tempt software developers into creating novel applications for its routers. And a technology upgrade could allow the routers to take on even more tasks currently handled by separate servers.
snippet: Cisco Systems held a contest to tempt software developers into creating novel applications for its routers. And a technology upgrade could allow the routers to take on even more tasks currently handled by separate servers.
lead_paragraph: Update | 6:15 p.m.  This post has been changed to reflect that Cisco’s router module uses low-power PC chips, rather than Broadcom chips as was previously reported.

headline.main: Cisco Teaches Routers to Act Like Servers
